abstract_summ: Majority of Indian population demonstrated preceded good knowledge, positive attitude and good practice regarding COVID-19 pandemic.Health education program to improve the COVID-19 knowledge, attitude, practices and risk factors should be initiated to combat current health challenge.Two-thirds of the study participants, 1292(68.1%) had good knowledge score.Conclusion: Most students in Beijing hold a high level of knowledge, optimistic attitudes and have appropriate practices towards COVID-19.The present study was conducted among the Pakistani residents to observe the knowledge, attitude, practices and risk factors towards COVID-19 outbreak in Pakistan.
title_summ: Community-Based Assessment of Knowledge, Attitude, Practices and Risk Factors Regarding COVID-19 Among Pakistanis Residents During a Recent Outbreak: A Cross-Sectional SurveyPredictors of misconceptions, knowledge, attitudes, and practices of COVID-19 pandemic among a sample of Saudi population and its impact: a cross-sectional studyIndian communitys Knowledge, Attitude & Practice towards COVID-19Knowledge, attitudes, and practices towards COVID-19 among primary and middle school students during the COVID-19 outbreak period in Beijing: An online cross-sectional surveyKnowledge, Attitude and Practice Toward COVID-19 Among the Public in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia: A Cross-Sectional StudyThe infodemics of COVID-19 amongst healthcare professionals in India
title_abstract_phrases: Majority of Indian population demonstrated preceded good knowledge, positive attitude and good practice regarding COVID-19 pandemic.However, the results showed that men have less knowledge, less optimistic attitudes, and less good practice toward COVID-19, than women.Conclusion: Most students in Beijing hold a high level of knowledge, optimistic attitudes and have appropriate practices towards COVID-19.Health education program to improve the COVID-19 knowledge, attitude, practices and risk factors should be initiated to combat current health challenge.Predictors of misconceptions, knowledge, attitudes, and practices of COVID-19 pandemic among a sample of Saudi population and its impact: a cross-sectional studyObjectives: To explore the predictors of misconceptions, knowledge, attitudes, and practices of the COVID-19 pandemic among a sample of the Saudi population and its impact.
